Issues.Title: Cleanup pipeline and get it ready for RC 1
Issues.Body:
- Remove old variable groups
- Fix internal download location.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Cleanup pipeline and get it ready for RC 1" (#7574)

Issues.Title: Port WNDCLASS
Issues.Body:
Ports `WNDCLASS` and style definitions. Convert `NMHDR`.

Port `LoadCursor`, `LoadIcon`, `ShowCursor`, and `DestroyWindow`.

Ports `CreateWindowEx` and manually implments `AsAny` marshalling. Note that arbitrary arrays are not supported in this change, but simple arrays of intrinsic types still are (`int[]`).

Adds `IHandle<HWND>` to `HWND` to reduce the need for multiple overloads (see `IsChild` and `SetParent`).


###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://portal.fabricbot.ms/api/codeflow?pullrequest=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/7573)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Port WNDCLASS" (#7573)

Issues.Title: Could not find file 'C:\<deletedfile>'
Issues.Body:
### Environment

Microsoft Visual Studio Community 2022 (64 bits) - Current Version 17.3.0


### .NET version

Not sure - the latest (I'm a beginner)

### Did this work in a previous version of Visual Studio and/or previous .NET release?

Not sure 

### Issue description

I was trying to make my solution to a template because just copying and pasting the solution folder was not working to open in a new computer - showing the error pipe name timed out DesignToolsServer. 
So I tried to make my solution a template then open this template in a new computer - which worked "better", only that when opening on the new computer, it tried to find a file that was in my other computer.
So I deleted the file on my old computer hoping that the solution could open without it (it was an image and I had already made a copy of it with a different name and put in on the solution folder). However, now I can't even open the solution on my own computer, because the file was deleted, but the solution keeps trying to find it.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/40918340/183985716-5f446376-983a-4e43-82ab-b6bc0632615f.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/40918340/183985780-2bf91d30-3631-42ac-a23e-523b4825a18c.png) (As you can see the image is not on the Resouce window).
How can I remove the reference to this image that doesn't exist anymore using visual studio community 2022?


### Steps to reproduce

Add a image to your project, attach it to a image control and delete it manually. Your designer should break

### Diagnostics

```text
em StreamJsonRpc.JsonRpc.d__143`1.MoveNext()
--- Fim do rastreamento de pilha do local anterior onde a exceção foi gerada ---
em System.Runtime.ExceptionServices.ExceptionDispatchInfo.Throw()
em System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.HandleNonSuccessAndDebuggerNotification(Task task)
em Microsoft.DotNet.DesignTools.Client.Host.ServerHost.d__16.MoveNext()
--- Fim do rastreamento de pilha do local anterior onde a exceção foi gerada ---
em System.Runtime.ExceptionServices.ExceptionDispatchInfo.Throw()
em System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.HandleNonSuccessAndDebuggerNotification(Task task)
em Microsoft.DotNet.DesignTools.Client.DesignToolsClientLoader.d__29.MoveNext()
--- Fim do rastreamento de pilha do local anterior onde a exceção foi gerada ---
em System.Runtime.ExceptionServices.ExceptionDispatchInfo.Throw()
em System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.HandleNonSuccessAndDebuggerNotification(Task task)
em Microsoft.DotNet.DesignTools.Client.DesignToolsClientLoader.<>c__DisplayClass25_1.<<-ctor>b__1>d.MoveNext()
--- Fim do rastreamento de pilha do local anterior onde a exceção foi gerada ---
em System.Runtime.ExceptionServices.ExceptionDispatchInfo.Throw()
em System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.HandleNonSuccessAndDebuggerNotification(Task task)
em Microsoft.DotNet.DesignTools.Client.DesignToolsClientLoader.d__27.MoveNext()
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Could not find file 'C:\<deletedfile>' " (#7570)

Issues.Title: Upgrading packages which reference lower version of Newtonsoft.Json
Issues.Body:
The current version of updated packages reference (or transitively reference) a lower version of `Newtonsoft.Json (v9.0.1)`.
The upgraded versions reference v13.0.1 which is the prescribed version.

Note: Following packages are in use for Analyzers' testing, but their latest version available on nuget.org still uses v9.0.1 of `Newtonsoft.Json`. We are talking to Roslyn team about this issue.

•	Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CSharp.Analyzer.Testing.XUnit
•	Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CSharp.CodeFix.Testing.XUnit
•	Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CSharp.CodeRefactoring.Testing.XUnit
•	Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CSharp.SourceGenerators.Testing.XUnit
•	Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.VisualBasic.Analyzer.Testing.XUnit
•	Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.VisualBasic.CodeFix.Testing.XUnit
•	Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.VisualBasic.CodeRefactoring.Testing.XUnit

###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://portal.fabricbot.ms/api/codeflow?pullrequest=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/7571)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Upgrading packages which reference lower version of Newtonsoft.Json" (#7571)

Issues.Title: Change ReleaseUiaProvider method to set Accessibility object to null
Issues.Body:
Fixes #7567


## Proposed changes

- Added Properties.SetObject(s_accessibilityProperty, null); in Control.ReleaseUiaProvider(IntPtr handle).

Issues.Title: ReleaseUiaProvider method won't work correctly if Control.ReleaseUiaProvider doesn't set Accessibility object to null
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

.NET Version: 7.0

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

No

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

_No response_

### Issue description

Control control.ReleaseUiaProvider(control.Handle) only works correctly if Control.ReleaseUiaProvider(IntPtr handle) sets Accessibility object to null (via Properties.SetObject). This is being found while working on https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/7362.

The proposed solution is to add Properties.SetObject(s_accessibilityProperty, null); in Control.ReleaseUiaProvider(IntPtr handle).

### Steps to reproduce

Test memory leaks as described in https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/issues/7329
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "ReleaseUiaProvider method won't work correctly if Control.ReleaseUiaProvider doesn't set Accessibility object to null" (#7567)

Issues.Title: Please add a modern Tab control to WinForms
Issues.Body:
### Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe

The only problem is a lack of a modern Tab control, not a technical problem.

### Describe the solution you'd like and alternatives you've considered

https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/blob/main/docs/roadmap.md told me to submit control requests here.

I would REALLY like to see WinForms gain a modern Tab control.  The Windows Tab control is, meh, ok.  But it doesn't have options like adding a close button to each tab.  See SSMS or Visual Studio for examples of modern Tab controls.

Happy to discuss specifics if needed.

### Will this feature affect UI controls?

Yes.

* Yes, designer support would be required.  
* It is a new control, I assume accessibility will be required.
* I would assume localization would also be required.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Please add a modern Tab control to WinForms" (#7562)

Issues.Title: Remove conflicting interop structs
Issues.Body:
Removed our `RECT`, `HDC`, etc structs in favor of cswin32. This necessitated changing all of the existing P/Invokes back to `[DllImport]` as the `[LibaryImport]` doesn't work with the source generated types.

- Remove all `using foo =` workarounds.
- Push forward to cswin32 daily build to address bool cast issue
- New cswin32 uses System.Drawing types where plausible (`POINT` -> `Point`, as we currently do).


###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://portal.fabricbot.ms/api/codeflow?pullrequest=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/7561)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Remove conflicting interop structs" (#7561)

Issues.Title: Make wrapper explicit on IHandle<T>
Issues.Body:
With an explicit `IHandle<T>.Wrapper` we can avoid boxing when `IHandle<T>` is implmented on a struct and passing `IHandle<T>` to `GC.KeepAlive()`.

Issues.Body:

Issues.Title: Introduce IHandle<T>
Issues.Body:
Add typed IHandle to keep handles typed. Add HandleRef<T> that derives from IHandle<T> to use where direct binding with IHandle<T> is not always necessary.

Port a number of User32 APIs to cswin32 to vet design.

First commit starts transitioning to global usings for interop to make porting easier.

###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://portal.fabricbot.ms/api/codeflow?pullrequest=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/7546)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Introduce IHandle<T>" (#7546)

Issues.Title: DataGridView's cell mouse tooltip does not display when the cell is not selected in specific case
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

.NET SDK 7.0.100-rc.1.22405.9

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

No

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

No, it's not a regression issue, also repro on .NET 6.0.

### Steps to reproduce

1. Open the attached solution: [DGV_DataBind_ToolTip.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/9280770/DGV_DataBind_ToolTip.zip)
2. Extract and open the project.
3. Build and run the project.
4. The DataGridView cell1 in row1 is selected by default, and the current row's cells have mouse tooltips, then hover with the mouse over next rows' cells to observe

### Current Behavior
DataGridView's cell mouse tooltips does not display when the cell is not selected in step4 except the cell text is truncated
![test789415](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/86937911/183386406-813dfbe0-6071-419e-b200-f4b0aab94937.gif)


### Expected Behavior
DataGridView's cell mouse tooltips should always display because DataGridView's ShowCellTooloTips is True.

### More Info
1. The initial feedback ticket is: https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1585331
2. This issue may be caused by: https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/1681
3. This issue cannnot repro in DataGridView without dataBind
4. .NET Framework does not support mouse tooltip.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "DataGridView's cell mouse tooltip does not display when the cell is not selected in specific case" (#7552)

Issues.Title: removing unused GDIPlus
